Detailed Description

Various utilities for dealing with phone number strings.

const gaia::base::String &  a,
const gaia::base::String &  b 
) [static]

Compare phone numbers a and b, and return true if they're identical enough for caller ID purposes.

Checks a resource to determine whether to use a strict or loose comparison algorithm.

static bool gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::compareLoosely ( const gaia::base::String &  a,
const gaia::base::String &  b 
) [static]

Compare phone numbers a and b, return true if they're identical enough for caller ID purposes.

  • Compares from right to left
  • requires MIN_MATCH (7) characters to match
  • handles common trunk prefixes and international prefixes (basically, everything except the Russian trunk prefix)

Note that this method does not return false even when the two phone numbers are not exactly same; rather; we can call this method "similar()", not "equals()".

static gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::convertKeypadLettersToDigits ( const gaia::base::String &  input) [static]

Translates any alphabetic letters (i.e.

[A-Za-z]) in the specified phone number into the equivalent numeric digits, according to the phone keypad letter mapping described in ITU E.161 and ISO/IEC 9995-8.

Returns:
the input string, with alpha letters converted to numeric digits using the phone keypad letter mapping. For example, an input of "1-800-GOOG-411" will return "1-800-4664-411".
gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( PhoneNumberUtils  ) [private]
static gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::extractNetworkPortion ( const gaia::base::String &  phoneNumber) [static]

Extracts the network address portion and canonicalizes (filters out separators.) Network address portion is everything up to DTMF control digit separators (pause or wait), but without non-dialable characters.

Please note that the GSM wild character is allowed in the result. This must be resolved before dialing.

Allows + only in the first position in the result string.

Returns null if phoneNumber == null

static gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::formatNumber ( const gaia::base::String &  source) [static]

Breaks the given number down and formats it according to the rules for the country the number is from.

Parameters:
sourceThe phone number to format
Returns:
A locally acceptable formatting of the input, or the raw input if formatting rules aren't known for the number
static bool gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::isEmergencyNumber ( const gaia::base::String &  number) [static]

isEmergencyNumber: checks a given number against the list of emergency numbers provided by the RIL and SIM card.

Parameters:
numberthe number to look up.
Returns:
if the number is in the list of emergency numbers listed in the ril / sim, then return true, otherwise false.

Return true iff the network portion of address is, as far as we can tell on the device, suitable for use as an SMS destination address.

static gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::normalizeNumber ( const gaia::base::String &  phoneNumber) [static]

Normalize a phone number by removing the characters other than digits.

If the given number has keypad letters, the letters will be converted to digits first.

Parameters:
phoneNumberthe number to be normalized.
Returns:
the normalized number.

static int32_t gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::toaFromString ( const gaia::base::String &  s) [static]

Returns the TOA for the given dial string Basically, returns TOA_International if there's a + prefix.

static gaia::base::String gaia::telephony::PhoneNumberUtils::toCallerIDMinMatch ( const gaia::base::String &  phoneNumber) [static]

Returns the rightmost MIN_MATCH (5) characters in the network portion in *reversed* order.

This can be used to do a database lookup against the column that stores getStrippedReversed()

Returns null if phoneNumber == null
